An ACT 10 PROVIDE FOR THE FRORIBITION, REGULATION OR CONTROL OF THE FELLING OF TREES. . [Date of Assent: March 16, 1951.]

BE it enucted by the King’s Moot Exealont Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and the House of Representatives of Ceylon in this present Parliament assembled, and-by the authority of the same, as follows: —
4. ‘This Act may be cited as the Felling of Treo» chon wie: (Control) Act, No. 9 of 1951.
2, (1) The Minister may by Order provide for the Ovten prohibition, regulation ‘er control of the felling of Prmmint trees of such description as may be specified in the te fing Order. ov

(8) Every Order made by the Minister under this rection shall be published in the Gazette and shall conte into operation upon the date of sach publication or upon such later date as may be specified therein.

(4) Every Order made by the Minister under this section shall, as soon as practicable after it comes into i operation as hereinbefore provided, be laid before the Senate and the House of Representatives; and if a resolution is passed by the Senate or the House of Representatives. within forty days after the Onder is a0 laid, that the Order shall be annuiled, the Order shall with effect from the date of the resolution be void. but withont prejudice to anything previously done thereunder.
Every order which ia not so anuulled shall be as valid and effectual as though it were herein enacted.
